alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:37AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Gilchrist and Suwannee Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 737 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mayo, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Bell, Ichetucknee Spring, Dowling Park, Obrien, Mcalpin, Luraville, Branford, Hildreth and Newburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
